1.desc_api: Ottawa (6-4) looks to rebound from its 21-11 home loss to Montreal on Friday night. After three straight 300-yard games, quarterback Trevor Harris threw for 270 yards and had two picks. B.C. (3-6) is coming off the bye but has lost two straight and will be without receiver Manny Arceneaux (knee). There’s also talk running back-returner Chris Rainey, the CFL’s all-purpose yardage leader (1,525), could be benched.

2.title_api: Tennessee-ETSU game features matchup of ex-FSU assistants
2.desc_api: Tennessee-ETSU game features matchup of ex-FSU assistants
2.caption_api: FILE - In this Sept. 1, 2018, file photo, Tennessee head coach Jeremy Pruitt directs his team against West Virginia in an NCAA college football game in Charlotte, N.C. Tennessee’s home opener with East Tennessee State matches two first-year coaches and former colleagues against each other. Tennessee’s Jeremy Pruitt was a defensive coordinator and ETSU’s Randy Sanders was quarterbacks coach on Florida State’s 2013 national championship team. (AP Photo/Chuck Burton, File)

6.title_api: Labour Day Hangover: Tiger-Cats tend to follow wins with letdowns
6.desc_api: By the numbers, Hamilton is 19-10-1 in its last 30 Labour Day games — and 6-24 in games immediately following, which is a trend they’ll try to buck in a return engagement against the Toronto Argonauts at BMO Field on Saturday.
6.caption_api: Tiger Cats turned out in fine form for the Labour Day Classic against the Toronto Argonauts at Tim Horton’s Field on Monday

7.title_api: Tiger-Cats’ Banks, Masoli and Tasker sweep CFL top performer awards for Week 12
7.desc_api: The Tiger-Cats’ trio of receiver/returner Brandon Banks, quarterback Jeremiah Masoli and receiver Luke Tasker were 1-2-3 in the Week 12 top performer selections.

8.title_api: Ticats show maturity by shaking off red-zone fumble
8.desc_api: A 100-yard scoop-and-score Argos touchdown rolled off of Hamilton like water off of a duck’s back on Monday, Steve Milton writes
8.caption_api: Alex Green and his teammates responded dramatically to what could have been a season-crippling turnover in the third quarter of Monday’s Labour Day Classic.

9.title_api: LABOUR DAY CLASSIC: Ticats rally to beat Argos 42-28
9.desc_api: It sure looked like the Hamilton Tiger-Cats were going to ruin their own party, but looks can be deceiving.
9.caption_api: Dave Blackmore disagreeing with an official’s call at Tim Hortons Field at the Labour Day Classic between the Ticats and the Argos.

10.title_api: Banks reaches 3,000 yards in Ticats’ win
10.desc_api: Tiger-Cats’ Brandon Banks has seen career take off since last Labour Day
10.caption_api: Ticat No. 16 Brandon Banks is brought down on a 35-yard run.

12.title_api: Giants special teams co-ordinator dealing with cancer
12.desc_api: Giants special teams co-ordinator dealing with cancer
12.caption_api: New York Giants special teams coordinator Thomas McGaughey leaves after speaking to the media in East Rutherford, N.J., Thursday, Sept. 6, 2018. McGaughey has been doing more in the offseason than getting the Giants‚Äô special teams ready for the opener against the Jacksonville Jaguars. The 45-year-old coordinator has undergoing treatment for a rare form of cancer that strikes roughly 8,000 people in the United States annually. (AP Photo/Tom Canavan, File)

13.title_api: Chiefs’ Mahomes ready for his era to begin in Kansas City
13.desc_api: Chiefs’ Mahomes ready for his era to begin in Kansas City
13.caption_api: FILE - In this Dec. 31, 2017, file photo, Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes (15) throws against the Denver Broncos during the second half of an NFL football game in Denver. The differences between Patrick Mahomes and Alex Smith are undeniable, one of them an up-and-coming quarterback with a big arm and little experience, the other the consummate game manager whose ability to avoid mistakes has served him well over the years. There are also some similarities, though. (AP Photo/Jack Dempsey, File)

14.title_api: Stamps’ star receiver out for season
14.desc_api: Calgary Stampeders star receiver Kamar Jorden out for rest of year
14.caption_api: Calgary Stampeders’ Kamar Jorden, left, celebrates his touchdown with a teammate during first quarter CFL football action against the Montreal Alouettes, in Calgary, Saturday, July 21, 2018. Jorden is out for the year and is facing knee surgery. THE CANADIAN PRESS/Jeff McIntosh

15.title_api: Jon Gruden set for return for Raiders in opener against Rams
15.desc_api: Jon Gruden set for return for Raiders in opener against Rams
15.caption_api: FILE - In this Aug. 18, 2018, file photo, Los Angeles Rams head coach Sean McVay, right, greets Oakland Raiders head coach Jon Gruden after their NFL preseason football game, in Los Angeles. There is quite a bit of intrigue in what Gruden’s offense will look like in his first game as coach in 10 years. He spent the past nine seasons after being fired in Tampa Bay as the analyst for “Monday Night Football.” Gruden spent much of the offseason talking about wanting to bring the Raiders back to 1998. He showed almost none of his offense in the preseason but his former protege and current Rams coach Sean McVay knows to expect the unexpected.(AP Photo/Kelvin Kuo, File)

16.title_api: College football teams get creative to reward big plays
16.desc_api: College football teams get creative to reward big plays
16.caption_api: This undated photo provided by the Tulane Athletics Department shows the team’s Takeaway Beads. NCAA college football sidelines across the country are featuring everything from wrestling-style robes to boxing gloves as teams try to mimic the success Miami had last season with its turnover chain. (Tulane Athletics Department via AP)

20.title_api: Argos vs Ticats: The best Labour Day Classics of the 21st century
20.desc_api: It’s bigger than black, gold and double blue
20.caption_api: More than 29,000 fans packed Ivor Wynne Stadium for the 2004 Labour Day Classic and while Tim Hortons Field isn’t as big, the fans will be every bit as intense when the Tiger-Cats and Argonauts meet Monday at 6:30 p.m.

21.title_api: Hamilton Tiger-Cats edge Edmonton Eskimos on final-play field goal
21.desc_api: Jeremiah Masoli threw for a whopping 419 yards and the Tiger-Cats, after being plagued by early mistakes, scored the last 15 points to win the kind of games that have often slipped away from them this season.
21.caption_api: Ticats’ Luke Tasker shakes Edmonton players as he heads to the end zone for a touchdown to bring the game to withing two points at 24-22. A last-second field goal would tip the game in the Ticats’ favour.

Wiley was ejected for targeting Thomas on the play, but should return against Nevada Saturday. Vanderbilt smothered a mobile quarterback in their season opener against Middle Tennessee and will face another potent offense in Nevada. (AP Photo/Mark Humphrey)

But lose to Georgia on a high stakes SEC opener for both teams and the Gamecocks will likely spend another season in the national shadows. (AP Photo/Rainier Ehrhardt, File)
